name: Shadow Ministers
description:
3-5 players networked "card" game

Cards have political "titles" on them (e.g. Premier of Tasmania, Mayor of Tasmania etc.). 9 cards in total, no duplicates.

Deal 1 card to each player on game start, face down, discard left overs.

Each player also starts with 3 political influence (currency)

HOW TO WIN

1. Guess correctly the card for every player in the game (including yourself)

OR

2. First to get 10 political influence

On your turn, do 1 of 5 actions

1. Take a guess (or informed decision) at all the cards each player has. They need to guess everything correctly to win. The game will not reveal who has what on failed guess, but everyone can see what you guessed.

2. Sacrifice yourself - At the cost of 3 political influence, you can reveal a card of any other player. This card is revealed to everyone (not just you), but then goes back to being face down

3. Swap your card with another player's (or not) - You initiate a swap with another player, but it's up to you (hidden from everyone else) whether you follow through with the swap

4. Gather influence - Gain 1 political influence

5. Look at your card (secretly)
